issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description: When it upgrades a eucalyptus package, packaging writes the old version's number to /etc/eucalyptus/.upgrade.  On RHEL 6, the init script runs euca-upgrade in response to that file's existence, then deletes it.  On RHEL 7, systemd runs euca-upgrade in response to that file's existence, but there is no init script to delete it afterwards.  That file will remain and cause euca-upgrade to run every time the CLC starts.  This will become a problem the first time we run an upgrade on RHEL 7, namely in the first 4.3 maintenance release.

comments.body: Testing commit to remove /etc/eucalyptus/.upgrade file when successfully upgraded DB.

Fixed in commit 14a77fb6fe68f5076dccff6348871e30a20a350c:

Name        : eucalyptus-cloud

Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus
Summary     : Eucalyptus cloud platform - cloud controller
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License     : GPLv3
Description : Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
            : using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
            : with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
            : computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
            : 
            : This package contains the cloud controller part of eucalyptus. The cloud
            : controller needs to be reachable by both the cluster controller and from
            : the cloud clients.
